title: Russian missiles and drones strike eastern Ukraine Dnipro in a daylight attack that kills 5
message:
Russian missiles and drones strike eastern Ukraine's Dnipro in a daylight attack that kills 5KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — A Russian missile and drone attack on the eastern Ukrainian city of Dnipro on Wednesday killed five civilians and injured 47 others, including a 14-year-old girl, authorities said.
Blasts blew out some windows of a shopping mall, raining shards onto the street, photos published by local officials showed.
Mayor Borys Filatov said the daytime attack also shattered windows in two schools and three kindergartens.
In the Kharkiv region in the northeast, Russian shelling struck a village council building, killing one person and injuring two others, regional head Oleh Suniehubov said.
Elsewhere in the region, a Russian glide bomb struck a residential building in the village of Ruska Lozova, injuring at least two people.

title: Senior Hezbollah commander killed in Israeli strike in S . Lebanon - Xinhua
message:
BEIRUT, July 3 (Xinhua) -- A Hezbollah military leader was killed on Wednesday in an Israeli airstrike that targeted a civilian car in the Al-Hosh area, east of Lebanon's southwestern city Tyre, Lebanese military sources told Xinhua.
The sources said that the driver was identified as a commander of a military unit in Hezbollah whose nickname was Hajj Abu Ni'mah.
He came from the village of Haddatha in southern Lebanon and worked at the borderline in the western and central sectors of the southern border area.
The military sources said that Israel also launched three airstrikes on villages and towns in southern Lebanon and fired about 30 shells at five border villages and towns.
The level of tension between Hezbollah and the Israeli army has escalated recently, as the Israeli military announced "its approval of operational plans for an attack on Lebanon."
event_breakdown:
Israel launches targeted attacks on southern Lebanon, killing Hezbollah commander
The Israeli military on Wednesday launched several airstrikes on southern Lebanon, killing a military commander from Hezbollah in an attack near Tyre. Israel also shelled five Lebanese border villages and towns, causing extensive damage. The conflict between the two regional powers comes amid heightened security tensions along their shared border.

title: Russian attacks across Ukraine kill 7 , injure 44 over past day
message:
Russian attacks across Ukraine killed seven people and injured 44 over the past day, regional authorities said on July 3.
In Dnipropetrovsk Oblast, four people were killed and 11 injured in Russian attacks, according to Governor Serhii Lysak.
Nikopol, situated on the banks of the dried-up Kakhovka Reservoir, just across from Russian-occupied Enerhodar and the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant, is a regular target of Russian attacks.
In Kherson Oblast, Russian forces carried out attacks against 27 settlements, including the regional center of Kherson.
In Zaporizhzhia Oblast, one man was injured in the Russian attack on the Polohy district, local military administration reported.
event_breakdown:
Russian attacks across Ukraine killed at least seven people and injured 44 over the past day, regional authorities said on Saturday, with four people killed in Dnipropetrovsk Oblast and 11 injured, according to Governor Serhii Lysak. 
In Kherson Oblast, Russian forces carried out attacks against 27 settlements, including the regional center of Kherson, while in Zaporizhzhia Oblast, a man was injured in the Russian attack on the Polohy district, local military administration reported.

title: Suspected hit - woman Aimee Betro arrested in Armenia
message:
Suspected hit-woman arrested in ArmeniaAimee Betro is wanted by police in connection with an attempted assassinationA suspected hit-woman being hunted by police investigating an assassination attempt has been tracked down in Armenia.
Aimee Betro was taken into custody on Tuesday after she was found in a housing complex on the outskirts of Yerevan, Police of the Republic of Armenia said.
She is wanted by West Midlands Police in connection with the attempted shooting of a businessman outside his home in South Yardley, Birmingham, in September 2019.
Mohammed Aslam and Mohammed Nazir, both from Elms Avenue, Derby, were recently found guilty of conspiracy to murder.

title: Gaza ceasefire effort shows signs of revival as Israel pounds enclave
message:
Gaza ceasefire effort shows signs of revival as Israel pounds enclavereuters_tickers5 minutesBy Nidal al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem and Maayan LubellCAIRO/GAZA/JERUSALEM (Reuters) – Signs of renewed activity emerged on Wednesday in the quest for a ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas in the nine-month-old war in the Gaza Strip while Israel launched more strikes on the devastated enclave.
Hamas says any deal must end the war and bring a full Israeli withdrawal from Gaza.
Sparked by the Gaza war, the hostilities with Lebanon have raised concerns about a wider and ruinous conflict between the heavily armed adversaries, prompting U.S. diplomatic efforts aimed at deescalation.
The war in Gaza began when Hamas gunmen burst into southern Israel on Oct. 7, killed 1,200 people and took around 250 hostages back into Gaza, Israel says.
An Israeli airstrike also destroyed a U.N. school in Khan Younis in southern Gaza, where displaced Palestinians sheltered.

title: Italian Air Force 156th Squadron Reactivated At Luke AFB
message:
The 156° Gruppo (Squadron) at Luke AFB, Arizona, will be the F-35 OCU (Operational Conversion Unit) of the Italian Air Force.
The Italian Air Force has been present at the American base for some time, supporting pilot training activities with a contingent of seven F-35As deployed in Arizona under the command of RAMI (Rappresentanza Aeronautica Militare Italiana – Italian Air Force Mission) Eglin.
History of the 156th SquadronThe 156th Squadron was established on Jan. 20, 1941, at Comiso airport, in Sicily.
Following the Cuban Missile Crisis, the 156th Squadron was the first Italian unit to achieve “Strike” capability for the use of nuclear weapons.
Shortly before the transfer, the 156th Squadron abandoned its nuclear capability, returning to its initial role of conventional bombing.

Luke AFB
Arizona

A jury found Guadalupe DeLaCruz, 60, not guilty of 11 separate charges — including first-degree assault and child abuse — filed against him in relation to a 2022 shooting incident in Peru, Neb.

title: Israeli Drone Strike Kills Four in Nur Shams Camp
message:
Israeli forces assassinated four Palestinians, before midnight on Tuesday/Wednesday, when an armed drone fired a missile in the center of the Nur Shams refugee camp, east of Tulkarem in the northwestern part of the West Bank.
According to medical sources at the Martyr Thabet Thabet Governmental Hospital in Tulkarem, four Palestinian young men were killed by an Israeli drone strike in the center of the Nur Shams camp.
An Israeli drone strike killed a Palestinian woman, on Monday, and injured four others, while a soldier shot a 15-year-old child in the head with live ammunition, at the entrance to the Tulkarem refugee camp.
Military bulldozers caused severe destruction to vital infrastructure, including the main water line in the Nur Shams camp, in addition to citizens’ property, and also sabotaged several streets in various areas of Tulkarem city.
On Sunday, Israeli forces executed the young man, Saeed Izzat Jaber, 24, and injured five others, two seriously, after an armed Israeli drone fired three missiles at a citizen’s home in the Nur Shams camp.

title: Somalia : Shabaab Strikes Djiboutian and Somali Troops in Central Somalia As Atmis Forces Withdraw
message:
The al-Qaeda-affiliated group Shabaab has claimed responsibility for a suicide car bombing targeting Djiboutian and Somali troops at a military base in central Somalia.
The blast marks the 14th such suicide bombing conducted by the insurgent group so far this year, underscoring the persistent threat it poses as African Union forces withdraw from the country.
The suicide bombing hit the Beledweyne headquarters of Djiboutian troops attached to the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia (ATMIS) in the Hiraan region.
The timing of the attack is particularly significant, as it comes amid the gradual withdrawal of ATMIS forces from Somalia.
According to data compiled by FDD's Long War Journal, the latest blast marks at least the 14th suicide bombing carried out by Shabaab this year.

title: Hizbollah says launched rocket salvo at north Israel after civilian death
message:
Israel and Hizbollah, an ally of Hamas, have traded near-daily cross-border fire since the Palestinian fighter group's October 7 attack on Israel sparked war in the Gaza Strip.
Hizbollah fighters launched "dozens of Katyusha rockets" at army barracks in northern Israel "in response to the Israeli enemy's attacks... and the killing of a civilian", the Lebanese group said in a statement.
Earlier Tuesday, Lebanese state media, an official and a minister said an Israeli strike killed a civilian in the country’s south.
“The strike that targeted Bustan killed a civilian,” said Lebanon’s state-run National News Agency, after earlier reporting Israeli warplanes had struck the village.
Bustan Mayor Adnan Ahmed told AFP the strike killed Muhieddin Abu Dallah, a farmer in his 50s, and damaged his house and agricultural machinery.

title: A senior Hezbollah commander was killed in an Israeli strike in S . Lebanon – Ya Libnan
message:
Hezbollah confirmed the death of Mohammed Nimah Nasser and published this photoHezbollah confirmed that one of its senior commanders was killed in an Israeli air strike in southern Lebanon, with the Iran-backed armed group retaliating with a barrage of rockets against Israel.
Mohammed Nimah Nasser is the latest senior member of Hezbollah to be targeted by Israel during almost nine months of cross-border violence which have raised fears of an all-out war.
Hezbollah said it had launched 100 rockets and missiles at Israeli military positions “as part of the response to the assassination”.
The Israeli military said a number of projectiles which fell in open areas sparked fires, but no injuries were reported.
“Israel can decide what it wants: limited war, total war, partial war,” the group’s deputy leader, Naim Qassem, said in an interview with the Associated Press on Tuesday.

title: Man fatally stabs neighbor in Hollywood , police say
message:
A man was fatally stabbed in Hollywood Tuesday night, and his neighbor has been arrested in connection with the attack.
The stabbing at Yucca Street and Wilcox Avenue was reported at 11:45 p.m., according to the Los Angeles Police Department.
Officers arrived to find a man suffering from a stab wound to his chest.
The preliminary investigation revealed that the victim and his neighbor got into an altercation on Yucca Street before the neighbor pulled out “an unknown weapon” and stabbed the victim before fleeing, police said.
About an hour after the attack, police arrested the victim’s neighbor at his home.

title: Arrest made in stabbing at Orange County park , sheriff office says
message:
ORANGE COUNTY, Fla. – A 20-year-old man arrested in Seattle is accused of stabbing someone days earlier at an Orange County park, according to the sheriff’s office.
Michael Pierce Zaccardo, 20, was arrested via warrant Tuesday by the King County Sheriff’s Office in Washington.
Zaccardo faces a charge of attempted second-degree murder in a stabbing Saturday evening at Shadow Bay Park that left a man in his 20s hospitalized, the Orange County Sheriff’s Office said in a news release.
Zaccardo was positively identified in a photographic lineup by the man who was stabbed and by a member of park staff, the sheriff’s office said.
He will be held at the King County jail pending his extradition to Orange County.

title: Police say a roadside bomb has killed a former Pakistani senator and 2 others in northwest Pakistan
message:

title: USS MASON RETURNS TO MAYPORT FROM COMBAT DEPLOYMENT
message:
USS MASON RETURNS TO MAYPORT FROM COMBAT DEPLOYMENTUS Navy02 July 2024From ENS Emily MooreNAVAL STATION MAYPORT, Fla. -- Arleigh Burke-class guided-missile destroyer USS Mason (DDG 87) returned to Naval Station Mayport, July 2, 2024, after being deployed for more than eight months in the U.S.
While deployed, Mason faced unprecedented attacks from the Houthi terrorist group based out of Yemen.
While deployed, Mason intercepted multiple unmanned aerial vessels and anti-ship ballistic missiles targeting merchant vessels and coalition warships.
On Nov. 26, 2023, Mason responded to a distress call in the Gulf of Aden where five suspected pirates overtook M/V Central Park.
Once Mason arrived, the suspected pirates fled, and Mason's Visit, Board, Search, and Seizure team took custody of the suspected pirates and freed the crew stuck in the ship's citadel.

title: Russian missiles and drones strike eastern Ukraine Dnipro in a daylight attack that kills 5
message:
KYIV, Ukraine — A Russian missile and drone attack on the eastern Ukrainian city of Dnipro on Wednesday killed five civilians and injured 47 others, including a 14-year-old girl, authorities said.
Blasts blew out some windows of a shopping mall, raining shards onto the street, photos published by local officials showed.
Mayor Borys Filatov said the daytime attack also shattered windows in two schools and three kindergartens.
In the Kharkiv region in the northeast, Russian shelling struck a village council building, killing one person and injuring two others, regional head Oleh Suniehubov said.
Elsewhere in the region, a Russian glide bomb struck a residential building in the village of Ruska Lozova, injuring at least two people.

title: Russian attacks on Kharkiv region kill one , injure four
message:
KYIV (Reuters) - One person was killed and another four wounded in Russian attacks in Ukraine's northeastern Kharkiv region on Wednesday, according to local authorities.
Kharkiv regional prosecutors said one person was killed and two wounded in an attack in the village of Borova that also damaged 10 homes, stores and an administrative building.
Russia has repeatedly denied targeting civilians since launching a full-scale invasion of its neighbour in February 2022.
Regional governor Oleh Syniehubov said in June that attacks near the village of Borova had intensified as Russian forces sought to strike logistics and probe weaknesses in the Ukrainian defences.
Russia pressed its ground assault into the north of the Kharkiv region in May, opening a new front in the 28-month war.

title: Hamas sends new  idea on halting war
message:
The Palestinian resistance movement Hamas said Wednesday it has sent new "ideas" to Qatari mediators aimed at ending the nearly nine-month Gaza war with Israel.
Israel confirmed that it was "evaluating" Hamas "comments" on a deal to see its hostages in the Palestinian territory freed and would reply.With the death toll from nearly nine months of war mounting and conditions worsening daily for Gazans, both sides are under increased international pressure to agree a ceasefire.Qatar, working with the United States, has been leading the mediation.
"We exchanged some ideas with the mediator brothers with the aim of stopping the aggression against our Palestinian people," a Hamas statement said.The office of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and the Mossad intelligence service confirmed the new approach.
"Israel is evaluating the remarks and will convey its reply to the mediators," said an Israeli statement.Tens of thousands of Palestinians have fled southern Gaza since Israel issued an evacuation order, amid fears of a new offensive in the area which came under Israeli bombardment yesterday.On Israel's northern front, Lebanon's Hezbollah said it fired 100 rockets at Israeli targets in retaliation for a strike that killed a senior commander, heightening fears of full-scale war between the longtime foes.The United Nations said war had "unleashed a maelstrom of human misery" and that the latest evacuation order had plunged yet more Palestinians into "an abyss of suffering".Ten days after Netanyahu said the war's "intense phase" was winding down, the Israeli military again rained down air strikes and artillery fire on the Shujaiya district.

message:

message:

title: Russian air defense downs at least 3 HIMARS missiles over Donetsk
message:
Russian air defense systems downed at least three HIMARS missiles, launched at civilian targets, over the Kievsky District of this morning, the DPR mission to the Joint Coordination and Control Center (JCCC) on Ukrainian war crimes told TASS.
"Earlier this morning, the air defense system downed at least three HIMARS MLRS missiles over the Kievsky District of Donetsk.
Still, one M-31 missile hit a shopping mall building, which is now completely destroyed," the mission said.
"It was the operation of the air defense system that made it possible to avoid mass causalities that would have certainly been caused by such amount of long-range missiles," the mission underscored.
According to the regional Ministry of Emergency Situations directorate’s Telegram channel, 16 firefighters and 4 vehicles are involved in the extinguishing of the fire that broke out in the destroyed shopping mall and currently covers 300 square meters.

title: Strike kills family as Israeli military orders evacuation of southern Gaza city
message:
The Hamdan family — around a dozen people from three generations — fled their home in the middle of the night after the Israeli military ordered an evacuation from the southern Gaza city of Khan Younis.
The Israeli military did not immediately respond to requests for comment on the strike.
The order also prompted a frantic flight from European General Hospital, Gaza’s second-largest hospital, located in the evacuation area.
Hours after ordering the evacuation, the Israeli military said the hospital was not included in that order.
On Tuesday, cars loaded with personal belongings streamed out of eastern Khan Younis, though the number of those fleeing was not immediately known.

title: German tank maker Rheinmetall eyes deal worth billions with Italy
message:
Henning Kaiser/dpaThe German armaments group Rheinmetall is positioning itself for a major order worth billions of euros from Italy for the delivery of hundreds of tanks and other armoured vehicles.
The Düsseldorf-based company intends to set up a joint venture with the Italian armaments giant Leonardo.
The two companies will each hold a 50% stake in the joint venture, which will develop a main battle tank and an infantry fighting vehicle.
Rheinmetall already has three subsidiaries with around 1,400 employees at five locations in Italy.
The letter of intent for the joint venture must still be approved by the relevant regulatory authorities before it can be implemented.

title: Rufina Peter Pioneer Legacy Trek 2024
message:
FOR the first time in history, the Central Provincial MP Rufina Peter is set to walk the two historical bush tracks that crisscross her province starting on Monday July 15.
Ms Peter made this announcement yesterday at the Central Provincial Government headquarters at Konedobu.
The ‘Rufina Peter’s Pioneer Legacy Trek 2024’ will start with the famous Kokoda Track at Myola, a village which was used by allied troops to drop of supplies.
The world famous Kokoda Track is a 96 kilometres journey from Owers Corner in Sogeri, Central Province across the rugged Owen Stanley Ranges to Kokoda in Northern Province.
She will also use that time to identify the proposed date when Central Province and its people on an annual basis celebrate our people and their efforts during World War II.

title: Bangkok Post - Killer of Canadian gangster in Phuket pleads guilty
message:

Dupre and Lahrkamp arrived together at Phuket International Airport on Dec 18, 2021, the Thai police investigation determined.
Canadian police, investigating at the behest of their Thai counterparts, suspected the slaying was linked to a gangland feud in British Columbia.
Dupre was arrested on Feb 20, 2022 by the Royal Canadian Mounted Police at his home in Sylvan Lake.
Thai authorities agreed to waive the death penalty in the case in order to satisfy Canadian requirements for extradition.

title: Angus King presses military to begin brain screenings immediately
message:
Sen. Angus King, I-Maine, is calling on the military to immediately begin brain screening for service members to better monitor for blast-related injuries.
AdvertisementCard had been “exposed to thousands of low-level blasts” during years of training service members in New York state, according to Army personnel records.
Boston University conducted a forensic analysis of Card’s brain tissue and concluded that the brain injuries likely played a role in his declining mental health and behavioral changes before the mass shooting.
The Army has said it plans to conduct baseline screenings for new soldiers during basic training, but King wrote the reforms are not moving fast enough.
In fact, it has taken a grassroots effort from military widows to truly begin connecting the dots and elevating this threat,” King wrote.

title: The Ukraine War in 2024 : A Pivotal Year for the Transatlantic Alliance and World Order
message:
The Ukraine War in 2024A Pivotal Year for the Transatlantic Alliance and World OrderJohn Nagl and Alexander PerisRussia’s brutal invasion of Ukraine is now in its third year.
For Ukraine, Russia’s access to global resources and weaponry means the military environment has become considerably more difficult.
John Nagl is Professor of Warfighting Studies at the United States Army War College and director of the Ukraine War Integrated Research Project there.
He is currently supporting the Ukraine Integrated Research Project, synthesizing the lessons from the war in Ukraine for the U.S. Army.
This article reflects their views and not those of the United States Army War College, the United States Army, or the Department of Defense.
event_breakdown:
Nagl and Peris predict that in 2024, the war will reach a pivotal point, with the year shaping the future trajectory of the transatlantic alliance and the world order. They argue that Russia’s access to global resources and weaponry will make the military environment considerably more difficult.
Nagl and Peris stress the importance of continued support for Ukraine and warn that Russia’s actions will have long-term implications for global security. They cite Russia’s history of using military force to achieve geopolitical goals and argue that it will continue to pose a threat to neighboring countries in the decades to come.
Nagl and Peris conclude that it is crucial for the United States and the European Union to remain united in their condemnation of Russia’s actions and to support Ukraine in its efforts to resist Russian aggression.

title: Russian missiles and drones strike eastern Ukraine Dnipro in a daylight attack that kills 5
message:
(You can now subscribe to our(You can now subscribe to our Economic Times WhatsApp channelA Russian missile and drone attack on the eastern Ukrainian city of Dnipro on Wednesday killed five civilians and injured 47 others, including a 14-year-old girl, authorities said.Blasts blew out some windows of a shopping mall, raining shards onto the street, photos published by local officials showed.
Mayor Borys Filatov said the daytime attack also shattered windows in two schools and three kindergartens.
Debris struck the intensive care unit of a children's hospital, and a fire broke out in another hospital.A video posted on social media by President Volodymyr Zelenskyy showed a missile with a fiery trail streaking over buildings in Ukraine 's fourth-largest city, and debris flying into the air from its impact.The war, now in its third year since Russia invaded its neighbor, has killed more than 10,000 civilians and wounded around 20,000 others, the United Nations says.In the Kharkiv region in the northeast, Russian shelling struck a village council building, killing one person and injuring two others, regional head Oleh Suniehubov said.Elsewhere in the region, a Russian glide bomb struck a residential building in the village of Ruska Lozova, injuring at least two people.
Others could be trapped under rubble, Syniehubov said.Also Wednesday, Ukraine received $2.2 billion from the International Monetary Fund under an ongoing credit facility, Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal announced.The credit program foresees the disbursement of $16 billion, but Ukraine must pass IMF reviews of its progress on key economic and fiscal benchmarks before each part is released.The latest funds will be used for welfare payments and the salaries of doctors and teachers, among other things, Shmyhal said.
event_breakdown:
Location: Russian missile and drone attack on the eastern Ukrainian city of Dnipro on Wednesday killed five civilians and injured 47 others, authorities said.

It was reported that blasts blew out some windows of a shopping mall, and photos published by officials show pieces of glass from the street.

During the attack, debris struck a school, a kindergarten and and intensive care unit of a children's hospital. In addition to the civilian deaths, the attack caused a fire at another hospital.
Mayor Borys Filatov said the Russian missile trail in the video lasted about 8-10 seconds and the strike came during the day.

title: Fourth Suspect in Desert Hot Springs Hotel Stabbing Case Pleads Guilty
message:
The last of four suspects in a stabbing at a Desert Hot Springs hotel pleaded guilty Wednesday to multiple charges.
Jaime Eduardo Reynaga, 39, pleaded guilty to assault causing great bodily injury and first-degree burglary Wednesday at the Larson Justice Center in Indio.
Three other men charged in the case, 30-year-old Jose Luis Garcia, 32-year-old Moises Mazariegos and 30-year-old Anthony Rene Ayala, previously pleaded guilty to the same charges.
The stabbing occurred around 11 p.m. April 15, 2021, at a hotel in the 11000 block of Palm Drive, according to the Desert Hot Springs Police Department.
Ayala has two robbery convictions, Garcia has convictions for burglary and attempted robbery, and Reynaga and Mazariegos have convictions for burglary and robbery.

title: Senior Hezbollah commander killed in Israeli strike in Lebanon
message:
A senior Hezbollah commander was killed on Wednesday, July 3, in an Israeli airstrike in the Hosh area of Tyre, Lebanon amid increased tensions between the two sides.
The 59-year-old Mohammad Naameh Nasser, also known as Haj Abu Naameh, was the third most senior Hezbollah commander killed by Israel since the outbreak of cross-border clashes in October 2023.
Israeli airstrikes killed the commander of Hezbollah’s Nasr Unit, Taleb Sami Abdallah, on June 12 and commander, Wissam Al-Tawil who is also known as Jawas was deputy head of the elite Rawdan force of Hezbollah on January 8.
Several hours after the strike, the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) confirmed that it had killed Nasser, describing him as the head of a unit responsible for firing into Israel from southwest Lebanon.
In Israel, at least 21 people, including 10 civilians, have been killed in Israel due to Hezbollah’s rocket fire and other attacks on civilian areas, Al Jazeera reported.

The Israeli air raid killed 59-year-old Mohammad Naameh Nasser, also known as Haj Abu Naameh, who was reportedly responsible for firing rockets into Israel from southwest Lebanon.
* A military outpost belonging to government forces in Syria's central province of Homs was struck by Israeli warplanes on the night of July 5, according to a war monitor. The attack, which killed two Syrian soldiers, came hours after Israeli military said aircraft struck "observation posts and intelligence collection systems" in southeast Lebanon.
* In the Gaza Strip, Palestinian militants fired at least one rocket towards Israel in the early hours of Thursday night, shortly after Israel and Hamas, the winners of Palestinian elections, reached a ceasefire.
* A PKK terrorist was arrested in the southeastern Mardin city of Turkey on July 5. The terrorist, responsible for attacks and murders targeting Turkish forces with a handmade bomb, was arrested by the Provincial Gendarmerie Command Anti-Terrorism Branch.

title: Life and death in Gaza  safe zone  where food is scarce and Israel strikes without warning
message:
Life and death in Gaza’s ‘safe zone’ where food is scarce and Israel strikes without warningJehad Alshrafi / APKHAN YOUNIS, Gaza Strip — An Israeli airstrike slammed into a residential building next to the main medical center in Gaza’s southern city of Khan Younis, wounding at least seven people, hospital authorities and witnesses said Wednesday.
Nasser Hospital sits in the western part of the city, which is inside the Israeli-designated humanitarian “safe zone” where Palestinians have been told to go, according to maps provided by Israel's military.
The latest Israeli evacuation order affected about 250,000 people earlier this week across wide swathes of Gaza, the United Nations estimated.
The Israeli military did not immediately comment on the strike.
The Israeli military said Tuesday it estimates at least 1.8 million Palestinians are now in the humanitarian zone it declared, covering a stretch of about 14 kilometers (8.6 miles) along the Mediterranean.

title: Slovakia reclassifies PM shooting as terror attack
message:
(You can now subscribe to our(You can now subscribe to our Economic Times WhatsApp channelBratislava: Slovak authorities have reclassified the assassination attempt on Prime Minister Robert Fico and are investigating it as a terror attack, not as attempted murder, a spokeswoman said on Thursday.Fico is recovering from serious injuries he suffered when a gunman shot him four times from close range after an off-site government meeting in central Slovakia on May 15.The gunman, identified by Slovak media as 71-year-old poet Juraj Cintula, was charged with premeditated attempted murder and remanded in custody.
"It has been reclassified," Zuzana Drobova, a spokeswoman for the general prosecutor's office, told AFP.
"We let the suspect know today that it is now classified as a particularly serious crime of terror attack," she added without giving further details.The 59-year-old Fico leads a three-party governing coalition of his centrist populist Smer-SD party, the centrist Hlas and the far-right SNS.He underwent two lengthy surgeries in a hospital in the central Slovak city of Banska Bystrica and was transferred for home treatment to the capital Bratislava on May 31.

title: Verdict due over deadly Oslo Pride attack
message:
July 4, 2024 — Oslo (AFP)A Norwegian court is set to deliver its verdict Thursday on a shooter who killed two people hours before Oslo's 2022 Pride festival, shocking the placid country and leading to the cancellation of the parade.
Zaniar Matapour, who pledged allegiance to the Islamic State group, is accused of opening fire on June 25, 2022 outside two bars in central Oslo, including a famous gay club, just hours before the Pride Parade.
Norway's public prosecutor has sought the maximum penalty of 30 years behind bars -- with possible extensions -- for the 45-year-old Norwegian of Iranian origin.
But the public prosecutor considered him criminally responsible and said that he deliberately targeted the LGBTQ community.
Oslo's Pride festival, scheduled to take place a few hours after the shooting, was eventually cancelled.
event_breakdown: The Norwegian court is set to deliver its verdict Thursday on a shooter who killed two people hours before Oslo's 2022 Pride festival.

message:
BEIRUT (AP) — The Lebanese Hezbollah group said it launched over 200 rockets on Thursday at several military bases in Israel in retaliation for a strike that killed one of its senior commanders.
Hours after the killing, Hezbollah launched scores of Katyusha rockets and Falaq rockets with heavy warheads into northern Israel and the occupied Syrian Golan Heights.
Two other senior Hezbollah commanders have also been killed.
Hezbollah says it is striking Israel in solidarity with Hamas, another Iran-allied group that ignited the war in Gaza with its Oct. 7 attack into southern Israel.
Israel sees Hezbollah as its most direct threat and estimates that it has an arsenal of 150,000 rockets and missiles, including precision-guided missiles.

title: Russia says it destroyed Ukrainian fighter jet , vehicles - World
message:
MOSCOW: Russia’s defence ministry on Thursday said its troops had destroyed a Mig-29 fighter jet during a strike on an airbase in central Ukraine.
The jet and other equipment and vehicles were destroyed in the base at Dolgintsevo, which was hit by an Iskandar ballistic missile, it said.
On Tuesday, Russia said it had destroyed five Ukrainian Su-27 fighter jets at a base near Myrgorod, about 150 kilometres (about 90 miles) from the Russian border.
Russia ramps up arms production as US boosts support for UkraineKyiv is waiting for the delivery of long-awaited F-16 fighter jets from its Western allies.
The protection of bases where they will be stationed is a key challenge for Ukraine and its partners.
event_breakdown:

title: Lebanon Hezbollah rains rockets on Israel as Gaza war rages
message:
Lebanon's Hezbollah rains rockets on Israel as Gaza war ragesBEIRUTLebanon's Hezbollah said it launched more than 200 rockets and explosive drones at Israeli military positions on Thursday as tensions have soared amid the almost nine-months-old war raging in Gaza.
Israel and Hezbollah, an ally of Palestinian militant group Hamas, have exchanged near daily cross-border fire since the Gaza war erupted on October 7, stoking fears that the clashes could escalate into a new all-out war.
Gaza war grinds onThe Gaza war broke out after Hamas's October 7 attack on southern Israel resulted in the deaths of 1,195 people, mostly civilians, according to an AFP tally based on Israeli figures.
Israel and Hezbollah, an ally of Hamas, have exchanged near daily cross-border fire since the Gaza war erupted, stoking fears of an escalation.
The Israeli military said its troops are fighting militants in the streets of Gaza City and destroying their infrastructure, tunnel shafts and weapons depots.
event_breakdown: On Thursday, Lebanese Shi'ite Muslim group Hezbollah said it had launched more than 200 rockets and explosive drones at Israeli military positions.

title: Israel considers Hamas response to Gaza ceasefire plan
message:
Israel received Hamas' response yesterday to a proposal made public at the end of May by US President Joe Biden that would include the release of about 120 hostages held in Gaza and a ceasefire.
Hamas has said any deal must end the nearly nine-month war and bring a full Israeli withdrawal from Gaza.
The Israeli military said that its troops and aircraft killed dozens of militants in those areas and in Rafah, in southern Gaza, which Israel has described as Hamas' last stronghold.
The war in Gaza began when Hamas gunmen attacked southern Israel on 7 October, killed 1,200 people and took around 250hostages back into Gaza, according to Israeli tallies.
The Israeli military said it hit targets in south Lebanon in response.
event_breakdown: Israel has been at war with Hamas for over a year. Israel began its latest round of air strikes in July after a year-long ceasefire broke down. Israel has bombed targets in Gaza for months, and Hamas has fired rockets at Israel. The Israeli blockade of the Gaza Strip has been in place since 2007. The current conflict has claimed the lives of thousands of people, most of them Palestinians.

title: The suspect in the attempted assassination of Slovakia prime minister now faces terror charges
message:
FILE - Bodyguards take Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico in a car from the scene after he was shot and injured following the cabinet's away-from-home session in the town of Handlova, Slovakia, on May 15, 2024.
Slovakias authorities started to investigate a suspect in an attempted assassination on populist Prime Minister Robert Fico as a terror attack, the countrys prosecutor general said on Thursday, July 4, 2024.
(Radovan Stoklasa/TASR via AP)BRATISLAVA – The suspect in the attempted assassination in May of Slovakia's populist prime minister, Robert Fico, is now facing terror charges as part of an investigation by authorities, the country’s prosecutor-general said Thursday.
The suspect, identified only as J.C., was originally charged with attempted murder.
His critics worry that Slovakia could abandon its pro-Western course and follow the direction of Hungary under Prime Minister Viktor Orbán.
event_breakdown: BODYGUARDS TAKE SLOVAK PRIME MINISTER ROBERT FICO IN A CAR FROM THE SCENE AFTER BEING SHOT AND INJURED DURING THE CABINET'S AWAY-FROM-HOME SESSION IN THE TOWN OF HANDLOVA, SLOVAKIA ON MAY 15, 2024.Zakaria K. was arrested on July 4 in the Slovak village of Durkovce on suspicion of ordering a contract hit on Fico and one other high-profile individual, TASR wrote. He has both Slovak and Spanish citizenship, the agency wrote. Three other suspects are also in police custody, and are suspected of carrying out the shooting on May 15, 2024.

title: Slovakia reclassifies PM shooting as terror attack
message:
Slovak authorities have reclassified the assassination attempt on Prime Minister Robert Fico and are investigating it as a terror attack, not as attempted murder, a spokeswoman said.
The gunman, identified by Slovak media as 71-year-old poet Juraj Cintula, was charged with premeditated attempted murder and remanded in custody.
"We let the suspect know today that it is now classified as a particularly serious crime of terror attack," she added without giving further details.
He underwent two lengthy surgeries in a hospital in the central Slovak city of Banska Bystrica and was transferred for home treatment to the capital Bratislava on 31 May.
Read more:Robert Fico and the rise of political violence in EuropeWhat does the Fico shooting mean for Slovak politics?
event_breakdown: In addition to the attack on Prime Minister Robert Fico, Slovak authorities are investigating a stabbing incident in a Tesco supermarket in the city of Trnava as a possible terror attack. According to media reports, a man stabbed five people, killing two of them, before fleeing. Police are searching for the suspect, described as a young man wearing a black hoodie and jeans. The incident is being investigated as a possible terror attack, and authorities have labeled it a "serious crime."

title: Israel weighs Hama latest response to Gaza cease - fire proposal as diplomatic efforts are revived
message:
Hezbollah has said it will halt its attacks if there is a cease-fire between Hamas — a fellow Iran-backed ally — and Israel.
Hamas suggested “amendments” to the proposal last month, some of which the U.S. said were unworkable, without providing specifics.
An Israeli official said Netanyahu would convene a Cabinet meeting Thursday to discuss the latest developments surrounding the negotiations.
Under the current proposal, Hamas could release all of the remaining men, both civilians and soldiers, during the second phase.
Hamas is concerned that Israel will restart the war after the first phase, perhaps after making unrealistic demands in the talks.

title: Iranian - born Norwegian man found guilty in 2022 Oslo LGBT+ festival attack , sentenced to 30 years
message:
COPENHAGEN, Denmark (AP) — An Iranian-born Norwegian man was found guilty of terrorism on Thursday in a 2022 attack on an LGBTQ+ festival in Oslo and sentenced to 30 years in prison.
The Oslo District Court said Zaniar shot 10 rounds with a machine gun and eight shots with a handgun into the crowd.
Matapour can request parole after 20 years but can only be released if he is deemed no longer dangerous.
Following the attack, a Pride parade was canceled, with police saying they could not guarantee security.
He was examined by a court-appointed psychiatrist who concluded that he was sane at the time of the attack.

title: Ex - senator among 5 killed in Bajaur explosion
message:
PESHAWAR (Pajhwok): Five people, including a former lawmaker, have been killed in a bomb attack in the Bajaur tribal district of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province.
Ex-senator Hidayat Ullah’s vehicle was attacked via a remote-controlled bomb in Damadola village late on Wednesday a police official said.
Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP) Bakht Munir confirmed Hidayat was killed in the bomb explosion along with four others.
The ex-senator had gone to Damadola in connection with electioneering for his nephew Najeeb Ullah Khan — a candidate for the PK-22 seat.
Hidayat came under attack on his way back to Khar, the Bajaur headquarters, police said.
event_breakdown: 5 killed in Bajaur bomb attack

title: Iranian - born Norwegian man found guilty over 2022 Oslo LGBT+ festival attack
message:
Two people were killed and nine were seriously wounded in the shooting at three locations, chiefly outside the London Pub, a popular gay bar, on June 25 2022.
The Oslo District Court said Zaniar Matapour, 45, fired 10 rounds with a machine gun and eight shots with a handgun into the crowd.
Prosecutors said Matapour has sworn allegiance to the so-called Islamic State (IS) group.
During the trial, both the prosecution and the defence agreed that Matapour had shot into a crowd and there was no disagreement that the shooting was terror motivated.
The shooting shocked Norway, which has a relatively low crime rate but has experienced so-called lone wolf attacks in recent decades.

title: Al - Burhan restates rejection of negotiations with RSF
message:
General Abdel Fattah al-Burhan, the Commander-in-Chief of the Sudan Armed Forces (SAF), reiterated his repudiation of engagement in any negotiations that undermines the dignity of the armed forces or fails to meet the aspirations of the Sudanese people.
While addressing his troops, Al-Burhan reaffirmed his stance against negotiating with the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) who have been fighting with the SAF since 15 April 2023.
“We are committed to this battle until we achieve victory and that is all there is to it,” he asserted.
Al-Burhan cited that he is not opposed to negotiations in principle.
“We will not go to negotiations if we are forced into them and we will not negotiate while the enemy still occupies our homes and loots our wealth,” he declared.

It also agreed with Turkish aerospace and defense company Aselsan to explore opportunities for developing defense electronics technologies in the kingdom.
Last year, Saudi Arabia agreed to buy drones from Baykar, the biggest defense contract in Türkiye's history.
In a sign of mending ties, President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan visited Saudi Arabia in April 2022, and Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman (MBS) traveled to Türkiye in June of the same year.
For its part, Saudi Arabia is highly focusing on its economic and social reform program, known as "Vision 2030," which aims to lay the groundwork for an eventual post-oil future.

title: July 4th isnt really Independence Day . And we Americans get other history wrong , too
message:
To all Americans on this Independence Day: You’re doing it wrong.
Yes, folks, we Americans are doing it wrong by celebrating Independence Day on the wrong day.
Henceforth, that typographical error gave us the anniversary that we Americans celebrate as Independence Day.
That is why it ultimately took a six-year war to determine the question of American independence.
It hides in rubbish heaps and moves when no one is looking.” And American Independence Day is truly the foremost among them.

message:

message:
The Lebanese Hezbollah group says it has launched more than 200 rockets at several military bases in Israel in retaliation for a strike that killed one of its senior commanders.
It acknowledged on Wednesday that it had killed Mohammad Naameh Nasser, who headed one of Hezbollah's three regional divisions in southern Lebanon, a day earlier.
Hours later, Hezbollah launched scores of Katyusha rockets and Falaq rockets with heavy warheads into northern Israel and the occupied Syrian Golan Heights.
Hezbollah says it's striking Israel in solidarity with Hamas, another Iran-allied group that ignited the war in Gaza with its Oct. 7 attack in southern Israel.
Israel sees Hezbollah as its most direct threat and estimates that it has an arsenal of 150,000 rockets and missiles, including precision-guided missiles.

title: Hezbollah fires over 200 rockets into Israel after killing of senior commander
message:
BEIRUT (AFP): Lebanon’s Hezbollah said it launched more than 200 rockets and explosive drones Thursday at Israeli military positions as tensions have soared amid the almost nine-months-old Gaza war.
The Iran-backed militant group said its latest attack, which followed the launch of over 100 rockets the previous day, was in response to Israel’s killing of a senior Hezbollah commander.
Israel on Wednesday killed a senior Hezbollah commander, Mohammed Naameh Nasser, near the Lebanese coastal town of Tyre.
Israel and Hezbollah, an ally of Hamas, have exchanged near daily cross-border fire since the Gaza war erupted, stoking fears of an escalation.
The Israeli military said its troops are fighting militants in the streets of Gaza City and destroying their infrastructure, tunnel shafts and weapons depots.

title: Modern combat : Mobile repair shops offer quick battlefield fixes
message:
CHERNIHIV, Ukraine – At Ukraine’s 50th Regiment's repair and restoration facility, officers, soldiers, and volunteers watched as a self-loading container truck lowered onto the ground a black shipping container with an installed repair workshop inside.
The Tvii Krok (Your Step) charity, which designed this mobile repair complex, known as Workshop Locker, was handing it over to the regiment.
The charity makes two other versions of its mobile repair workshop: the Big-Locker tire service complex for trucks, armored vehicles, and cars, and the Locker, a mobile workshop on an all-wheel-drive truck.
“The tractors will bring a MaxxPro to a safe place, and we’ll be able to restore it without any problems,” Pavlo, a mechanic, told the Kyiv Independent.
Consider supporting the Kyiv Independent.
event_breakdown: Workshop Locker Charity Transferred to Ukraine’s 50th Regiment

title: Ft . Eisenhower announces new Garrison Commander during ceremony
message:
AUGUSTA, Ga. (WRDW/WAGT) - Fort Eisenhower announced a new Garrison Commander during a Change of Command ceremony on Wednesday.
Colonel Reginald Evans, relinquished his command to the incoming Fort Eisenhower Garrison Commander, Colonel Anthony Kazor.
Outgoing Garrison Commander Evans has been with the army since 1999.
Evans’ awards and decorations include: The Bronze Star Medal with (3OLC), Defense Meritorious Service Medal with (1OLC), Meritorious Service Medal with (2OLC), Army Commendation Medal with (4OLC), Army Achievement Medal, Joint Meritorious Unit Award, Meritorious Unit Citation Medal with (2OLC), National Defense Service Medal, Afghanistan Campaign Medal, Iraq Campaign Medal, Global War on Terrorism Expeditionary Medal, and Global War on Terrorism Service Medal.
William G. Kidd, SES, Director, Installation Management Command and Training spoke during the ceremony, along with Colonel Evans and Colonel Kazor.
event_breakdown: New Garrison Commander at Fort Eisenhower, Colonel Anthony Kazor, accepted command from Colonel Reginald Evans June 29.

title: Celebrating 161 years of the Nigerian Army : A legacy of bravery , service and national development , by Sani Kukasheka Usman
message:
Women in the Nigerian Army have increasingly taken on roles that were traditionally dominated by men, participating in combat, leadership, and technical positions.
The Nigerian Army’s modernization efforts include the establishment of an aviation corps, a giant stride in enhancing its operational capabilities.
In Jos, Plateau State, amidst the beautiful landscapes and rich cultural heritage, we honour the Nigerian Army’s legacy of bravery, service, and national development.
Let us not merely observe this milestone of the Nigerian Army but embrace it with the reverence and gratitude it so rightfully deserves.
I join millions of well-meaning Nigerians home and abroad, in celebrating our armed forces and wishing officers of the Nigerian Army a happy NADCEL 2024.
event_breakdown: Women in the Nigerian Army are increasingly taking on roles that were traditionally dominated by men, participating in combat, leadership, and technical positions. The Nigerian Army's modernization efforts include the establishment of an aviation corps, a giant stride in enhancing its operational capabilities. This was established on 22/06/2023.Jos. Plateau State is also the newest base of the aviation corps.

title: A militia attack on a Congo gold mine kills 6 Chinese miners and 2 Congolese soldiers
message:
A militia attack on a gold mine in northeastern Congo has killed six Chinese miners and two Congolese soldiers, the latest attack as violence worsens in the resource-rich regionGOMA, Congo -- A militia attack on a gold mine in northeastern Congo killed six Chinese miners and two Congolese soldiers, a civil society group said Thursday, the latest assault as violence worsens in the resource-rich region.
A militia known as the Cooperative for the Development of the Congo, or CODECO, claimed responsibility for the attack.
They attackers killed six Chinese miners and two Congolese troops, he added, and abducted two other miners, whose whereabouts remain unknown.
CODECO and the Zaire Militia are involved in a complex conflict, mixing economic ambitions and power struggles.
The Zaire Militia, a dissident faction of CODECO, fiercely opposes its former allies.

title: Poland seeks border guard help from Germany , Greece , Finland
message:
Poland seeks border guard help from Germany, Greece, FinlandWorld World Poland seeks border guard help from Germany, Greece, FinlandGreece is extending its fencing on its border with TurkeyFollow on Published On: Thu, 04 Jul 2024 20:36:15 PKTWARSAW (Reuters) - Poland hopes to bring in border guards and police from Finland, Germany and Greece to help patrol its frontier with Belarus, a senior official said on Thursday, amid mounting concerns over migration pressures from the east into Europe.
"Preparations are underway and these are countries that are very experienced in border protection.
The border between Poland and Belarus has become a flashpoint as Western officials accuse the government in Minsk of using migrants it brings from in from outside of Europe as "hybrid warfare".
Officials in Poland and Finland have warned in recent months that the number of people trying to cross via Belarus or Russia could rise significantly in the near term.
Greece is extending its fencing on its border with Turkey, while Finland seeks to close a new migrant route via Russia to Europe by deploying more border guard patrols, drones and electronic detectors and by building fences.
event_breakdown:
Poland seeks border guard help from Germany, Greece, Finland
Greece extends fencing on border with Turkey
Finland seeks close new migrant route via Russia

title: July 4th isnt really Independence Day . And we Americans get other history wrong , too
message:
To all Americans on this Independence Day: You’re doing it wrong.
Yes, folks, we Americans are doing it wrong by celebrating Independence Day on the wrong day.
Henceforth, that typographical error gave us the anniversary that we Americans celebrate as Independence Day.
That is why it ultimately took a six-year war to determine the question of American independence.
It hides in rubbish heaps and moves when no one is looking.” And American Independence Day is truly the foremost among them.
event_breakdown:
1- United States: Multiple states see violence on Independence Day
2- Ukraine: Military Situation Report (as of 12:00, 1 July 2022)
